job_details.degree_required: Bachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required.

jd: HelloHope you’re doing well! Role: Java Technical Lead Location: Austin, TX (Onsite Role)Experience: 12+ yrsTechnical Skills (Mandatory)Strong hands-on Java 8+ (Core Java, Exceptions Handling, Mult-Threading, Collections, IO Classes), Spring Core, Spring MVC, Spring boot, MicroservicesStrong hands-on REST based web servicesExperienced in Micro-Services Architecture, Scalable High Resiliency Systems and Secure coding practicesStrong hands-on any Middleware like Kafka (preferred), MQ, TibcoHands-on any one of RDBMS (Oracle, DB2, SQL Server)Strong exposure to Design Patterns, usage of such in the projectHands on experienced in tools like Junit, SonarQube, CI-CD pipeline (GitLab’s CICD or any similar), Maven, Git, Containerization (using Docker)Work experience on either of the following clouds - AWS, Azure, GCPWorking knowledge on Linux systems, Unix scriptingFront End ExperienceStrong experience in developer Web application using Angular 8+Strong experience in Typescript, CSS, HTML, JavaScript, integration with Rest API’sExperienced is writing unit test cases using Jasmine or KarmaOther skills/Experience (Mandatory)Earlier working experience in Development project for at-least 4-5 yrs (recent)Must be able to lead team of 4-6 developers, guide the team, review the code, status updates and hold the deliverables to meet commitmentsWork in onsite / offshore teams seamlesslyGeneralBachelor's degree in computer science engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required.Possess excellent written and verbal communication skillsSelf-driven by nature and capable to closely work with development and business teams to communicate impacts and to understand business requirements.Comfortable communicating cross-functionally and across management levels in formal and informal settings.Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions and in documentation as well.Should have strong analytical, debugging and performance tuning skills.Earlier work experience of working with distributed Agile teamsDeal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly.
